info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 12:53PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western York, eastern Cherokee and northeastern Union Counties through 130 PM EST... At 1253 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northeast of Union, or 7 miles southwest of Hickory Grove, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Blacksburg, Sharon, Hickory Grove, Smyrna, Kings Mountain State Park, Clover, Cherokee Falls, Saratt, Kings Creek and Bullock Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Conditions are favorable for development of a very brief, weak tornado. Be prepared to take immediate action if a tornado is sighted or a Tornado Warning is issued.
